keyMoments.title: Luffy's Determination at Enies Lobby
keyMoments.description: In the present timeline, Luffy demonstrates the crew's unwavering resolve to rescue Robin by jumping towards the waterfall at Enies Lobby.
keyMoments.significance: This moment frames the episode's flashback, showing how Shanks' influence shaped Luffy into a captain who will do anything for his crew.

keyMoments.title: Flashback to Red Hair Pirates in Foosha Village
keyMoments.description: The episode recaps the Red Hair Pirates' time stationed in Foosha Village where they befriended young Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: This flashback shows the crew's influence on Luffy's dreams and character development.

keyMoments.title: Shanks' Philosophy of Non-Violence
keyMoments.description: Shanks and his crew demonstrate their philosophy by refusing to fight Higuma over petty insults at Partys Bar.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the crew's maturity and wisdom, teaching young Luffy important lessons about when fighting is necessary.

keyMoments.title: Shanks Sacrifices His Arm for Luffy
keyMoments.description: Shanks rescues Luffy from the Lord of the Coast, losing his left arm in the process to save the young boy's life.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew captain's values and the depth of his care for Luffy, inspiring Luffy's entire journey.

keyMoments.title: Shanks Entrusts the Straw Hat to Luffy
keyMoments.description: Before departing Foosha Village, Shanks gives his treasured straw hat to Luffy as a symbol of their bond.
keyMoments.significance: The straw hat becomes the symbol of the Straw Hat Pirates and Luffy's promise to return it as a great pirate.

statusHistory.reason: Crew continues to operate as a powerful pirate crew

jollyRoger: Skull with red hair and crossed swords

keyMoments.title: Higuma Provokes Shanks
keyMoments.description: Higuma and his bandits confront Shanks at Partys Bar, insulting and provoking him in an attempt to assert dominance.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the conflict that leads to Luffy's kidnapping and Shanks' sacrifice.

keyMoments.title: Higuma Kidnaps Luffy
keyMoments.description: Higuma takes young Luffy out to sea and throws him into the ocean to die, demonstrating the bandits' cruelty.
keyMoments.significance: This act triggers the pivotal moment where Shanks loses his arm saving Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Higuma's Death
keyMoments.description: The Lord of the Coast emerges and devours Higuma, ending the bandit leader's life and his crew's threat.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the real dangers of the sea and eliminates the antagonist.

statusHistory.reason: Leader Higuma was killed by the Lord of the Coast
